runs.comm: swing straight away. Angles the good length ball in at the stumps, but after pitching it swerves away. De Kock is mindful of it and lets it go
142kph, spears this in at the base of off stump and this time the batsman has to play. Digs it out well enough
extra bounce too! This one is pitched shortish and just outside off, De Kock went for a little waft square through the off side. Beaten by the seam away. All that rain is making it's presence felt
full and on middle and leg, De Kock keeps to the crease and nudges to mid-on
makes some room and drills this into the covers. Starc goes full around middle and off. De Kock pushes to White at short cover. Nice timing

has to take it on the chin, literally! Was advancing and Starc did not like that at all. Dug this in short at 139 kph and it followed him. Bounced a little more as well and he had to cop it while trying to take evasive action. End of a fiery over
138 kph, starts on the pads and Amla tucks it around the corner. Neat little leg glance
139 kph, looks like De Kock is all fine but Australia continue the short-ball barrage. This one is too far down leg though. Lets it go and takes a wide
138kph, walks at him and mauls this through midwicket. It was length and it was smashed
137 kph, shortish on and around off stump. De Kock is fancying giving himself some room. Doesn't succeed as much as he would like as he dabs this to point
this one's even better! Coulter-Nile strays a bit too full and that's where he's strong. Whipped away over the midwicket boundary. That's as clean as any you would see
charges him again as this is fullish on middle and the heave-ho misses completely. Bounces comfortably over the stumps. This pitch is quite fresh, folks
his line is all wrong here. This one's called a no-ball. Too short and this goes down leg.
backs away and thumps the fuller delivery on middle to mid-off
full and just outside off, Amla shuffles across and pierces the gap between cover and mid-off. Didn't look to hit too hard
low full toss seeking the base of leg stump. Think that was because of some late inswing. De Kock nudged towards midwicket and rushes through for a tight single

plumb in front, a Starc inswinger does Mighty Hash in! This was a terrific ball, kept nice and full and it swung in rather sharply too. Amla was stuck in his crease and was swiping across the line. Very unlike him, but he's been troubled by the ones that are full and at his stumps lately
fullish and teasing outside off, not bothered with
fullish and a touch of swing in again, Faf nudges between midwicket and mid-on and gets off the mark
speared in at leg stump again and De Kock is into a flick too early. Gets a leading edge into the covers.
makes room outside leg and carves this fuller delivery on odd towards mid-off
whipped through to the deep midwicket boundary. What footwork there! This is his homeground and he's already treating the fans. Chips down the track and times this away
moves around in his crease and works this fuller delivery behind square on the leg side

oops, he's chipped that straight to mid-off and Maxi sends him off with a stare. This happed in slow-motion. Faf moved outside leg again, the bowler followed up with a full one. He lifted it and I guess he wanted to beat the fielder, but the fielder backpedaled and chipped it straight to him
fuller delivery just outside off, and this grips and turns. JP pulls his bat away just in time
a touch shortish and this time JP rocks back and cuts through point. Simply looked to place it and despite all the bashing this outfield has taken, this runs almost to the boundary
pulled away as he starts off with a short one at the body. Doesn't have the pace to trouble De Kock

gorgeous stroke from JP! This just skims across a mound of sawdust and crashes into the extra cover boundary. It's even better because he took this on the up, got a good solid stride forward and came down with a straight bat.
opens the blade on impact with his shortish ball on off stump and finds point
back of a length on the legs, JP works it to short fine leg where Finch sends in a quick throw which snuffs out all thoughts of a single
again strays on the hips of JP and again he finds short fine leg.
waited for this one a little and steered this shortish ball on off stump to deep third man. This pitch is not helping the ball come on, but JP's timing is pretty much perfect
tossed up on the stumps and he lunges forward and sweeps this all alone the ground to deep square leg
full toss speared in on leg stump, he was caught midway through playing a sweep and gets struck on the front leg. Going down leg though
tossed up just outside off and he drives to mid-off
tossed up on middle and off, eases this into the covers
drags the length short and De Kock has pulled towards midwicket. Good placement as the man in the has to run to his left and saves a couple
skips down the track but gets too close to the flighted ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball, rather quick on middle and leg. Goes for the pull again and he's miscued it. Doesn't go past the inner ring, but it goes to the vacant area
that was the wrong 'un there. JP seems to have picked it as he shuffles across and tries to nudge towards short fine leg. Strikes on the thigh. Too high for that appeal
pierces the gap to perfection. His timing is something. Sweeps this dead square and bisects the two boundary riders. Bit too straight there from Hoggy
tucks him up on middle and leg as he sees the batsman advance, but De Kock is up for the challenge. Pulls to deep midwicket rather hard
flighted just outside off, he lunges forward and steers towards the point region
too eager was De Kock there. This was a length ball on middle and leg, JP shuffles and dabs into the leg side. Haddin gets to the ball too quickly

he's picked out the man at deep cover! <s>That was smoked, I tell you</s>. Ah, actually he had to reach out and it went off the open face. Tossed up on leg stump and he made some room to loft it over the infield and he would have hoped for it to go over the ropes too, but has to watch has Henriques comes up and pouches an easy catch
clipped towards deep midwicket
flighted on off stump, pushed to long-on
clipped to short fine leg as he goes forward and fetches this flighted ball from outside off
full toss on the stumps and AB whips to deep midwicket
drew him outside off with a length ball. De Kock shuffled across to cut but misses. Cry of anguish from the bowler.
tossed up and he sees it early enough. Charges to reach the pitch and nudge towards midwicket

this is not off the middle, folks. But AB's put so much power into it that it sails over midwicket. Horrible ball from Hogg as he drops it into the middle of the pitch. Had all the in this world and the next to line that up
driven through the covers for a single
length ball with room outside off, he's trying to make him stretch and so De Kock does and pulls through towards the midwicket boundary. There's a man there
full and wide outside off, De Kock stays leg side of it and flat bats it down the ground. Gave himself too much room and gets it off the bottom of the bat
good length ball on middle, AB covers his stumps and nudges to midwicket
fullish and just outside off stump, that was enough for AB to go for an expansive drive. Wanted to beat mid-off on his left, but doesn't succeed
that's very well bowled. He saw AB dancing down and making room and follows him. Tries to whip it away but doesn't connect properly
139kph, some late swing there as this ends up a full toss outside off. AB has to reach out and in his efforts the top hand comes off the bat. Carved towards deep point
full and just outside off, drilled down to long-on and that makes it just three off the over.
full toss on leg stump, De Kock heaves looking to clear the deep square leg boundary. Didn't find the middle and this drops just short of the boundary rider
wrong 'un and AB's picked it. Stays back and waits for the shortish ball to turn away and slaps it down to long-on
that's how you do it JP, says de Kock. Smeared over the extra cover boundary! Dances down the track to reach the pitch and launches it. I love how he swings his bat all the way through
looked to sweep this good length ball on leg and then decides against it. Nudged towards square leg

they're all finding the fielders on the boundary! Neat catch by Hodge at deep sqauare leg. This was short and asking to be hit. AB obliged with a pull but he has struck it hard and flat. Hodge comes forward and picks it as it was dying on him

they go up straight away, but the umpire disagrees. It was shortish and outside off so Miller went for a back cut. Haddin certainly thought there was a nick on this, he went up immediately and then Hogg joined in.
worked away towards the covers. They need a few more of these singles right now
lovely flight and turn for Maxi. Miller is drawn into a drive away from his body is beaten handsomely
fired in on middle and Miller drills it straight back down the ground. Maxi parries it over towards mid-on. Struck hard, that
fuller and flatter delivery bowled down the leg side. Will have to bowl that again
waits on the length ball just outside off and dabs in front of point
makes him play away from his body again. This was tossed up on off stump and turns away form him. Miller follows it and gets an outside edge to short third man
bounce and turn this time! Miller's certainly surprised as he tries his best to keep it down. Was seeking a drive on the up and this takes the shoulder of the bat and goes uppishly towards point.
slower ball, holds up on the pitch to spoil the cut shot

oh, tight run there! This was shortish and just outside off, Miller dabs it into the off side and looks up to see De Kock haring across. Henriques was also hot on his heels and underarms it towards the stumps. Direct hit and he was out
short ball on middle and leg, he's set up on the back foot and pulls towards deep square leg
the ball is definitely holding up! This one goes straight to short cover. Length ball angled across him and Miller seeks a drive on the up. Bad shot considering the pitch and he perishes
full and on off stump, driven through the covers
fullish and on the pads, nudged towards deep midwicket
loopy delivery on leg stump lures De Kock to play against the turn. The flick through midwicket materialises as a leading edge to short third man
hacked to long-on as this is tossed up on leg stump
good length ball, turning away. Morkel stays in the crease and pushes through the covers
too much flight that time. Ends up a low full toss way outside off and de Kock has slashed this in front of point. Skims off the saw dust inside the circle, but the man in the deep mops up

that is a corker! de Kock can just tuck his bat in under his shoulder and walk back. Tossed up on middle and leg but once this hits the pitch it turns viciously. He was playing with a closed bat looking for midwicket. Only manages an outside edge through to the keeper's gloves. Terrific take from Haddin as well. There's another golden oldies combo
googly to finish and this wasn't picked. Goes for the cover drive and gets an inside edge onto boot. Ends a beautiful spell from the chinaman
seemed a little early on that drive. This was a length ball on off stump, Albie is forward and finds short cover. Slow pitch, struggle for timing
offcutter on middle stump, lovely bowling from Henriques. The batsman makes some room and cuts to deep third man. Risky stroke
good length ball on middle, Parnell stays behind it and blocks
back of a length and this stays in the pitch a little longer as well. The back foot punch goes uppishly towards short cover.
backs away to the length ball and looks to muscle it through point, can't beat the man

picked up the lower ball and he presents a solid straight bat. That ploy works on any pitch. Keeps his front leg out of the way and lofts it down the ground. Didn't look to smash it, just wanted to find the placement
starts off with an offcutter as well. Stays back and picks it off to deep square leg
another slower ball with a bit of width and he waits for it and guides it to deep third man. Delicate
shortish and outside off, cuts to the sweeper
tapped to deep point as he stays leg side of the shortish ball outside off.
that's why he's in the side! Belted over cow corner! Length ball, just the perfect welcome back present for Albie and he clears that front leg and swings those big shoulders.
full and angled across him, Albie presents an angled blade and steers this to deep point
142kph, he tries anyway. Albie clears his front leg and drills this full delivery on off stump back at the bowler

135kph, whacked over midwicket! He made room outside leg and the bowler followed him with a short ball and it was climbing towards his head too. Albie's not too worried as he pounds this in front of square

139kph, take that! Yorker seeking to topple middle and Albie can't dig this out. Again favours making room, but this one isn't the kind of ball he can swing away to cow corner. Tries to kep it out but he's too slow
full and speared in on leg stump, looks to flick but doesn't connect

139kph, full delivery on off stump, thumped back to the bowler's knee and Starc doesn't even flinch. Wears a giant smile on his face as he returns to the top of the mark. White and Bailey are flabbergasted!
140kph, full ball slides down the leg side.
fullish on off stump, Hendricks gets in line and blocks
full and on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg
finds the gap between deep square leg and deep midwicket. This was a slower ball on middle and leg, waited for it and whipped it away. Nice adjustment, but the sluggish outfield keeps it to three
full and on leg stump, looks to clip it through midwicket, doens't succeed
short and angled across him, Parnell went into the pull a little too early and misses it altogether
140kph, full and outside off and this time he finds the middle but the drive finds long-off
yorker on leg stump, Hendricks is struck on the boot outside leg so no point to that appeal. Sneak a single as the ball squirts off to square leg
140kph, low full toss on middle and leg, Hendricks pushes towards mid-on
141kph, thick inside edge runs away to deep fine leg. This was full and was swinging into him as well. Parnell swung away and a better throw could have meant a run out
gets under this slower ball on middle, perhaps a little too much as he chips it straight over bowler's head. Long-on and long-off are at work
140kph, full toss and speared in low on middle and leg. Goes off the inside edge onto boot
full on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
backs away and looks to smash this back of a length ball on middle out of the park. No connection.
137kph, yorker on leg again. Those have been rather frequent. Digs it out towards midwicket
charges down the track and takes on this length ball. He'd ensured he had room enough to smite this over midwicket. A full swing of the arms gives him all the leverage he needs
full length ball on middle and leg, he clears his front leg and drills it down to long-on
139kph, full and wide outside off, Hendricks reaches out and dabs this to deep point
139kph, low full toss on leg stump, Hendricks slaps this to wide long-on

great work from Finch! I think he's stopped a boundary there running to his right at long-on. This is full on middle and leg, Parnell clears his front leg and slams this over the top and down the ground. it was almost crossed him and looked set to smash into the advertising hoardings, when Finch pushed his right hand out and knocked it back
